title: Update public profile field labels and add phone/number field

requirements.text: Update the Profile page (public profile section) user-facing labels to match the new business-oriented wording: Skills → "Business name", Programming Languages → "Slogan", Current Projects → "Business Description", Activity Interests → "Location".

quotes:
the profile page :
public profil titre : 
change Skills to Business name
Programmming languages to Slogan
Current Project  to business Description 
activity interests to location

acceptanceCriteria: On the Profile page edit form, the labels for the public-only fields are updated exactly to: "Business name", "Slogan", "Business Description", and "Location".
Any helper text/placeholder text that explicitly references the old field meaning is updated to be consistent with the new label intent (business-oriented wording).
No other unrelated labels are changed.

requirements.text: Add a new "Number" (phone/number) field to the user profile model, collected and saved from the Profile page when the profile visibility is Public, and hidden/cleared when visibility is Private (consistent with other public-only fields).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend Candid types include the new profile field (e.g., a Text field) for storing the number.
The Profile form shows a new input labeled "Number" only when Profile Visibility is Public.
When switching visibility to Private and saving, the stored number value is cleared (empty string) similarly to other public-only fields.
Saving and reloading the profile preserves the number value for Public profiles.

requirements.text: Update profile validation to include the new "Number" field (only when visibility is Public) with reasonable constraints and an English validation error message when invalid.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile validation is extended to validate the "Number" field only when visibility is Public.
If the number fails validation, the Profile form prevents save and displays an English error message near the field.
Existing validation behavior for other fields remains unchanged.

requirements.text: Update the Members Directory UI to display the renamed field labels for public profiles: "Business name", "Slogan", "Business Description", and "Location" (only when the corresponding values are present and the viewer is allowed to see them under existing visibility rules).

quotes:
change Skills to Business name
Programmming languages to Slogan
Current Project  to business Description 
activity interests to location

acceptanceCriteria: In Members Directory cards, the label "Skills" is replaced with "Business name".
In Members Directory cards, the label "Programming Languages" is replaced with "Slogan".
In Members Directory cards, the label "Current Projects" is replaced with "Business Description".
In Members Directory cards, the label "Activity Interests" is replaced with "Location".
Private profile behavior remains unchanged (public-only fields are not shown).

requirements.text: Update backend privacy filtering logic (getUserProfile and getMemberDirectory) to ensure the new number field is treated as public-only data: owner/admin can see it always; other users can see it only when the profile is Public; and it is blanked when returning a Private profile to non-owners.
acceptanceCriteria: For Private profiles viewed by a non-owner non-admin, the returned profile has the number field set to an empty string (not leaked).
For Public profiles viewed by another user, the returned profile includes the number field value.
Owner/admin views return the stored number value regardless of visibility setting.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing UI components instead.
Use English for all user-facing text (labels, headings, validation errors).
nonGoals: Do not add third-party authentication methods (only Internet Identity is supported).
Do not add new pages or navigation items beyond updating the existing Profile and Members pages.
Do not implement real-time updates via WebSockets.
